casebody.data:
BOARD OF EDUCATION OF THE BOROUGH OF FAIR LAWN, A PUBLIC CORPORATE BODY OF THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY, PLAINTIFF-RESPONDENT, v. MAYOR AND COUNCIL OF THE BOROUGH OF FAIR LAWN, DEFENDANTS-APPELLANTS. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Argued October 31, 1977 Decided November 15, 1977.

Before Judges Fritz, Botter and Ard.

Mr. Jack Ballan argued the cause for appellants. Mr. Reginald F. Hopkinson argued the cause for respondent (Messrs. Jeffer, Walter, Tierney, DeKorte, Hopkinson & Vogel, attorneys). *481Per Curiam.

We affirm the judgment below, substantially for the reasons set forth by Judge Pressler in her opinion appearing at 143 N. J. Super. 259 (Law Div. 1976).

Defendant’s belated motion to expand the record is denied.

Affirmed.
